I worked in a pet shop where the owners were Eileen and Ryan. They owned an African Grey that they had in the shop and also when they went home at night they took it. This bird learned one telephone noise and apparently I learned that these peoples relationship was way one-sided. All I heard when it was in the shop was "I love you Ryan" or the phone. I would have strangled this bird given the chance.
Three Amigos, Stranger than Fiction, and Amelie.

I'm new to the Rochester area too, I've been here for about four months and I've heard thru a few locals that fairport is the village to be in. And honestly everything is pretty easy to get to and not a lot of "bad" areas to be in. Everybody has been friendly and everything is super close by. No worries on where you end up but fairport is somwhere where I would pick. It is the burbs. Quiet and nice.
It's enough. I'm not looking for teenagers here. Just less than me.

I feel the same because of the fact that when I was younger I was sort of hit a lot by a "friend" in the face. That's all I can think of.

WRITING.TEXT: I've lived in a couple national parks and a few states. I've been to nearly all fifty and they are all particularly unique. I have also put more miles on my car criss-crossing the country a few times now than I thought I ever would. I wanted to see the desert and live in it. Terlingua was a gem to find. I know now that I need to have more greenery in my life. I hope you enjoy your time out there.
I got to live out here about two years ago about 30 minutes west of terlingua. Beautiful hostile environment. The sunsets every time we're outrageous. Beautiful pic you got here.
"Learn something about everything and everything about something"
The Brothers Bloom
Can I just have your paycheck?
The likelihood of you possibly knowing somebody that I know just increased so much.

Coolworks.com has changed my life by working seasonally in a few different national parks. It's a great way to see the country and meet folks from all over the world. So cheap to live in these places, too. In sequoia national park the rent was $100/month. I seriously recommend this as an option.

I have been a cook for about 12 years (female here) and I get it. Men have always been the group of people to go out with. It's just way simpler and I enjoy the comedy and company. Females have always made me feel so insecure and awkward.

I've worn it once maybe twice because I thought it's what I'm supposed to do and all I did was touch my eyes and smudge everything on my face. It felt exactly what it was, something on my face and I wanted it off.
Female

Used to watch this show called "Greetings From Tucson" and it ended prematurely because one of the main characters was killed in a small plane crash. I loved this show. I'd watch it with my dad. I didn't know all of this until many years later. Did anybody else see this show? I just feel like it's all my imagination that it even existed.
Direct center of the North American continent.
Allegedly woke up one night rifling through the sheets and was asked what I was doing and replied with "looking for my bag of cheese"

This was in Georgia about 9 years ago and I was waiting on the side of the highway for the bus, broke as fuck and just trying to get home to my then boyfriends moms house. This was the first time I had ever been in Georgia, let alone the first time that I had been out of my home state for sure. There was a tropical storm that was battering down on Georgia at the time, not enough to be a hurricane, but close. Regardless, I was soaked on the side of the road. There was this one car that stopped and instead of being creepy or anything dangerous at all, she throws open her trunk and pulls out a giant umbrella and just gives it to me. One could not tell wether my face was wet from rain or tears of joy but it made me so happy.
Make-up. Never understood it and don't want to.

Almost a year ago I made a confession to a dude whilst being in a year long relationship that I had an attraction to younger dude and stated my case. Broke up with then current. Got into do a friend with benefits thing and stilll have no idea where it's going because in my eyes., we are dating. There's lots of weirdness that I wish I had the balls to know what's going on but don't want to ruin a good thing.
Always remember that "this too shall pass" is a very common and regular constant in my life that I have to think about everything. I'm a line cook and always have to remind myself of it.
It cooks everything in a fraction of the time and still makes any protein super tender which is surprising. Also it's fun to cook with essentially a bomb.

WRITING.TEXT: When I was 15 or 16 I had "friends" that abused me. I think I was so desperate for a group of friends but it was always dark and cruel. I even ended up in the E.R once with a wound from a blunt force to my elbow which left my bone exposed. I lied to my dad at the time as to what happened to protect both my "friend" and myself from said person. I am now 29 and this still affects my daily life even if on small scales. I wish I had more courage back then.
Cat named Putz

WRITING.TEXT: Yeah, I used two rounds and then sliced the top mound off of both of them. Then covered them with the cream cheese/caramel mix. This cake baked extremely fast by not having it in the traditional loaf pan.
It's actually quite light in texture but oh so sweet! I've never put cream cheese frosting on banana bread ever but it seemed like a great idea. I feel like I created a new genre of caking.
As a bite this tastes like the most outrageous banana pudding ever.

Yes, I made a small batch of caramel sauce and then added about a third to a batch of frosting. I put that in between the two cake layers and sort of just put about 1/2 and inch on top of the cake. Then I took a bunch more of the caramel and just poured it on top. Then just swirl away. I had a lot of the caramel left over so I'm not too sure how much I used for that. However swirly you want to make it I guess. Have fun!

I guess I didn't think of that but total I believe it was 1 tablespoon vanilla, 1 1/2 teaspoons cinnamon and maybe 1 cup of crushed walnuts. Add nutmeg in there too if you like. Or any other "typical" banana" bread additions. This cake is most defiantly on the super sweet side so don't go too crazy.
I typed too fast and totally meant cream cheese frosting. I was wondering when I was going to get called on that one.

http://allrecipes.com/recipe/20144/banana-banana-bread/
This I doubled but added cinnamon, vanilla, and walnuts.
Meanwhile... http://allrecipes.com/recipe/245648/oh-so-easy-caramel-sauce/?internalSource=rotd referringId=17795 referringContentType=recipe%20hub clickId=cardslot%201
The cream cheese frosting was 4 cups cream cheese, 1 cup butter blended together with 3 cups powdered sugar. I mixed the caramel sauce in with a bit of the cream cheese mixture and then drizzled the rest on top then swirled.

I've stated this before on situations like this as a worst-case-scenario kind of thing when all the money is gone with no directions. Go to coolworks.com and often you can get a basic job such as a bellman or housekeeper if you don't have any skills whatsoever but often if you can pay to get to the job which are scattered throughout the country, they will support you with food and housing until you start making money and then rent is usually dirt cheap as well as the food being just as cheap. It's a great option to get a savings going and get back on your feet, even temporarily.

You can buy these little white ball things that look like the beads from a bean-bag chair at nearly any department store. Generally they will be in the closet supplies(hangers, shoe racks, clothes baskets etc). Super cheap and all you have to do is put them in a bucket of some sort and leave them in the car. They pull all the moisture out of wherever you put them. My car was recently moldy on the inside and needed this as part of the solution.

In my third grade class, my teacher was so into sign language that she "forced" it on us. Some days just to show us how hard it is for some, we weren't allowed to talk and could only sign. I really wish I would have kept more of that knowledge.

Also if you are feeling extra adventurous and want to save all that money that you have, check out the seasonal life of working in the national parks. It changed my life and whenever I think that I'm at a low point or near there, I know that they provide modest housing and will help feed me until the first paycheck with them. The website is called coolworks.com and it's totally worth looking into, especially somebody so young still. Good luck!
